WorkItem.Description:
With a ComboBox, one can use a CompositeCollection to merge different Collections and use ItemsSource to show them.
As long as the Items provide a ToString()-Function that returns the String the item's DataTemplate displays, even the AutoCompletion-Feature of a simple ComboBox (IsTextSearchEnabled-Property) works as expected.
 
The AutoCompleteBox provided here (WPF Toolkit February 2010 Release) seems not to work with CompositeCollections at all. The Items covered by a CollectionContainer cannot be found... Instead it lets you complete "Sys" to "System.Windows.Data.CollectionContainer" ;)
 
This is also discussed here:
http://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/wpf/thread/baafbb04-68e9-4c86-b4bd-61067f8a437b?prof=required&ppud=4
 
The attached VS2010 Beta 1 file allows you to compare the behavior of a ComboBox with the AutoCompleteBox.
 
- dartrax

Comments.Message:
Thanks for reporting this issue, and for taking the time to include a repro project, that definitely helps! For the time being, this is unfortunately "by design" as the AutoCompleteBox included in the WPF Toolkit is based almost entirely on the SL version. I do realize this should work though, and I will be contacting the control's owner to see if it's feasible to get it fixed.

Thanks!

Patrick
